001package org.consensusj.bitcoinj.signing;
002
003import org.bitcoinj.crypto.ECKey;
004import org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction;
005import org.bitcoinj.script.ScriptException;
006import org.bitcoinj.wallet.DeterministicKeyChain;
007import org.slf4j.Logger;
008import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
009
010import java.util.List;
011import java.util.Optional;
012import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
013import java.util.function.Supplier;
014
015/**
016 * A template interface, implementations need only implement {@link #keyForInput(TransactionInputData)}.
017 * The {@link HDKeychainSigner} implementation can sign transactions using a <b>bitcoinj</b> {@link DeterministicKeyChain}.
018 * <p>
019 * Keys and PubKeys can be searched for, but not UTXOs or amounts
020 */
021public interface BaseTransactionSigner extends TransactionSigner {
022    Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BaseTransactionSigner.class);
023    /**
024     * Create a signed bitcoinj transaction from the signing request
025     * <p>
026     * @param request Signing request with data for all inputs and all outputs
027     * @return A signed transaction (should be treated as immutable)
028     */
029    @Override
030    default CompletableFuture<Transaction> signTransaction(SigningRequest request) {
031        // Create a new, empty (mutable) bitcoinj transaction
032        Transaction transaction = new Transaction();
033
034        // For each output in the signing request, add an output to the bitcoinj transaction
035        request.outputs().forEach(
036                output -> transaction.addOutput(output.toMutableOutput())
037        );
038
039        // For each address in the input list, add a signed input to the bitcoinj transaction
040        request.inputs().forEach(
041                input -> addSignedInput(transaction, input, () -> new RuntimeException("Unsupported transaction input"))
042        );
043
044        log.info("signed tx: {}", transaction);
045
046        // TODO: Additional Transaction validation?
047        return verify(transaction, request.inputs())
048                .map(CompletableFuture::<Transaction>failedFuture)
049                .orElse(CompletableFuture.completedFuture(transaction));
050    }
051
052    default Optional<Exception> verify(Transaction tx, List<TransactionInputData> reqInputs) {
053        return tx.getInputs().stream().flatMap(i ->
054            verifyInput(tx, i.getIndex(), reqInputs.get(i.getIndex())).stream()
055        ).findFirst();
056    }
057
058    default Optional<Exception> verifyInput(Transaction tx, int index, TransactionInputData inputData) {
059        try {
060            log.info("Verifying input {}", tx.getInputs().get(index));
061            TransactionVerification.correctlySpendsInput(tx, index, inputData.script());
062            return Optional.empty();
063        } catch (ScriptException se) {
064            log.error("Invalid input", se);
065            return Optional.of(se);
066        }
067    }
068
069    /**
070     *
071     * @param tx Mutable transaction currently being built
072     * @param in The transaction input data
073     * @param exceptionSupplier exception to throw if key is not available.
074     */
075    default void addSignedInput(Transaction tx, TransactionInputData in, Supplier<? extends RuntimeException> exceptionSupplier) {
076        tx.addSignedInput(in.toOutPoint(),
077                in.script(),
078                in.amount(),
079                keyForInput(in).orElseThrow(exceptionSupplier),
080                Transaction.SigHash.ALL,
081                false);
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Return an ECKey, if available for the provided input
086     * @param input A transaction input
087     * @return The ECKey or empty
088     */
089    Optional<ECKey> keyForInput(TransactionInputData input);
090
091    default Optional<ECKey> pubKeyForInput(TransactionInputData input) {
092        return keyForInput(input).map(ECKey::fromPublicOnly);
093    }
094}
